Detailed Description

template<class TYPE>
class SAMRAI::math::PatchCellDataOpsReal< TYPE >

Class PatchCellDataOpsReal provides a collection of operations to manipulate float and double numerical cell-centered patch data. The operations include basic arithmetic, norms and ordering, and assorted miscellaneous operations. With the assertion of a few basic routines, this class inherits its interface (and thus its functionality) from the base classes PatchCellDataBasicOps, PatchCellDataNormOpsReal, and PatchCellDataMiscellaneousOpsReal from which it is derived. The name of each of these base classes is indicative of the set of cell-centered patch data operations that it provides.

Note that this templated class should only be used to instantiate objects with double or float as the template parameter. A similar set of operations is implemented for complex and integer patch data in the classes PatchCellDataOpsComplex and PatchCellDataOpsInteger, respectively.

See also:
math::PatchCellDataBasicOps
math::PatchCellDataMiscellaneousOpsReal
math::PatchCellDataNormOpsReal

Copy dst data to src data over given box.

Precondition:
dst && src
(dst->getDim() == src->getDim()) && (dst->getDim() == box.getDim())

References TBOX_ASSERT, and TBOX_ASSERT_OBJDIM_EQUALITY3.

template<class TYPE >
void SAMRAI::math::PatchCellDataOpsReal< TYPE >::swapData ( const boost::shared_ptr< hier::Patch > &  patch,
const int  data1_id,
const int  data2_id 
) const [inline]

Swap pointers for patch data objects. Objects are checked for consistency of depth, box, and ghost box.

Precondition:
patch
patch->getPatchData(data1_id) is actually a boost::shared_ptr<pdat::CellData<TYPE> >
patch->getPatchData(data2_id) is actually a boost::shared_ptr<pdat::CellData<TYPE> >
patch->getPatchData(data1_id)->getDepth() == patch->getPatchData(data2_id)->getDepth()
patch->getPatchData(data1_id)->getBox().isSpatiallyEqual(patch->getPatchData(data2_id)->getBox())
patch->getPatchData(data1_id)->getGhostBox().isSpatiallyEqual(patch->getPatchData(data2_id)->getGhostBox())

References BOOST_CAST, and TBOX_ASSERT.
